body:
I see this output from Spack:

```
SPACK_SHORT_SPEC=hdf5-blosc@master%gcc@6.1.0-spack arch=darwin-x86_64-2vj6sge
==> Warning: Keeping install prefix in place despite error.
  Spack will think this package is installed. Manually remove this
  directory to fix:
  /Users/eschnett/src/spack/opt/spack/darwin-
  x86_64/gcc-6.1.0-spack/hdf5-blosc-master-
  2vj6sge7werlurxr57qij5zaqa3k5idj
```

Note the many line breaks. I might understand a line break in the "Spack will think" message (although it's not necessary since the line is so short), but breaking a path name over multiple lines is both confusing and inconvenient. For example, this makes it impossible to copy and paste.
title: Path name in output is badly formatted
